title: The Console Awakens
subtitle: Your First JavaScript Program
description:
# Welcome to JavaScript Programming!

You've entered the world of **JavaScript** - the language of the web! JavaScript powers interactive websites, mobile apps, servers (Node.js), and even game engines.

## Your First JavaScript Statement

In JavaScript, you display text to the console using `console.log()`:

```javascript
console.log("Hello, World!");
```

**JavaScript Basics:**
- Statements can end with semicolons `;` (optional but recommended)
- JavaScript is **case-sensitive**: `console` is different from `Console`
- Strings can use single `'` or double `"` quotes
- JavaScript is **dynamically-typed** (variables can change types)

## Template Literals

JavaScript also has template literals (backticks) for easy string formatting:

```javascript
const name = "Developer";
console.log(`Hello, ${name}!`); // Hello, Developer!
```

## Your Quest

Write a JavaScript program that displays:

**Welcome to JavaScript!**

Then on a new line:

**Let's code the future!**

**Note:** This code runs in Node.js, which allows JavaScript to execute outside the browser.
